```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# Libraries

library(ggplot2)
library(tidyverse)
library(plotly)
```


```{r}
# Load the dataset

hotel_bookings <- read.csv("hotel_bookings.csv", na.strings="NULL")
View(hotel_bookings)
```


```{r}
# First look to the dataset

str(hotel_bookings) # check the data type of each column

summary(hotel_bookings)

```



```{r}
# Convert character columns into factors

hotel_bookings_new <- as.data.frame(unclass(hotel_bookings),
                       stringsAsFactors = TRUE)
attach(hotel_bookings_new)
```


```{r}
# Convert binary columns "is_canceled" and "is_repeated_guest" into factor

hotel_bookings_new$is_canceled <- as.factor(hotel_bookings_new$is_canceled)

levels(hotel_bookings_new$is_canceled) <- c(0, 1)



hotel_bookings_new$is_repeated_guest <- as.factor(hotel_bookings_new$is_repeated_guest)

levels(hotel_bookings_new$is_repeated_guest) <- c(0, 1)

```

```{r}
# Convert column "arrival_date_year" into factor

hotel_bookings_new$arrival_date_year <- as.factor(hotel_bookings_new$arrival_date_year)

levels(hotel_bookings_new$arrival_date_year) <- c("2015", "2016", "2017")
```

```{r}
# Convert column "children" into numeric

hotel_bookings_new$children <- as.numeric(as.character(hotel_bookings_new$children))
```


```{r}
# Type of each column

str(hotel_bookings_new)

# Summary

summary(hotel_bookings_new)
```



```{r}
# Missing values


# Replacing missing values in children column from the corresponding babies column

n_children <- length(hotel_bookings_new$children)
for (i in 1:n_children) {
  if (is.na(hotel_bookings_new$children[i]))
    hotel_bookings_new$children[i] <- 0
}

# Remove columns "agent" and "company"

index_agent <- which(colnames(hotel_bookings_new)=="agent")
index_company <- which(colnames(hotel_bookings_new)=="company")
hotel_bookings_new = hotel_bookings_new[-c(index_agent, index_company)]

view(hotel_bookings_new)
summary(hotel_bookings_new)
```



```{r}
# Count vs Month

ggplot(hotel_bookings,aes(factor(arrival_date_month,levels=month.name))) +
  geom_bar(col ="black",fill="#993333",alpha=0.5) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(face="bold", size=8, angle=30)) +
  scale_y_continuous("Count",limits = c(0,15000),breaks=seq(0,15000,by=1500)) +
  scale_x_discrete("Month")



```



```{r}
# City vs resort hotel

ggplot(hotel_bookings_new, aes(arrival_date_month, fill=hotel, colour=hotel))+ 
  geom_bar(position = "dodge")+
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(face="bold", size=8, angle=30)) +
  scale_y_continuous("Count",limits = c(0,15000),breaks=seq(0,15000,by=1500)) +
  scale_x_discrete("Month")
```


```{r}
# Total number of booking for each hotel plot

df_hotel <- as.data.frame(hotel_bookings_new[hotel_bookings_new$is_canceled==0, c("hotel")])
df_hotel <- as.data.frame(lapply(df_hotel, function(x) as.data.frame(table(x))))

colnames(df_hotel) <- c("hotel", "frequency")

df_hotel

fig_hotel <- df_hotel %>% plot_ly(labels = ~hotel, values = ~frequency)
fig_hotel <- fig_hotel %>% add_pie(hole = 0.6)
fig_hotel <- fig_hotel %>% layout(title = "Total number of booking for each hotel",  showlegend = T,
                      xaxis = list(showgrid = FALSE, zeroline = FALSE, showticklabels = FALSE),
                      yaxis = list(showgrid = FALSE, zeroline = FALSE, showticklabels = FALSE))

fig_hotel

```

```{r}
# Total guests for each hotel by month of arrival date

df_months_City <- as.data.frame(hotel_bookings_new[hotel_bookings_new$is_canceled==0 & hotel_bookings_new$hotel=='City Hotel', c( "arrival_date_month")])

df_months_Resort <- as.data.frame(hotel_bookings_new[hotel_bookings_new$is_canceled==0 & hotel_bookings_new$hotel=='Resort Hotel', c( "arrival_date_month")])

df_months_City <- as.data.frame(lapply(df_months_City, function(x) as.data.frame(table(x))))

df_months_Resort <- as.data.frame(lapply(df_months_Resort, function(x) as.data.frame(table(x))))

colnames(df_months_City) <- c("arrival_date_month_City", "frequency_City" )

colnames(df_months_Resort) <- c("arrival_date_month_Resort", "frequency_Resort")

df_months_City$arrival_date_month_City <- factor(df_months_City$arrival_date_month_City, levels = c("January", "February", "March","April", "May", "June", "July", "August", "September", "October", "November", "December"))

df_months_Resort$arrival_date_month_Resort <- factor(df_months_Resort$arrival_date_month_Resort, levels = c("January", "February", "March","April", "May", "June", "July", "August", "September", "October", "November", "December"))


fig_months <- plot_ly()

fig_months <- fig_months %>% add_lines(data=df_months_City, x = ~arrival_date_month_City, y = ~frequency_City, name = 'City Hotel', type = 'scatter', mode = 'lines', line = list(color = 'rgb(205, 12, 24)', width = 4))

fig_months <- fig_months %>% add_lines(data=df_months_Resort, x = ~arrival_date_month_Resort, y = ~frequency_Resort, name = 'Resort Hotel', type = 'scatter', mode = 'lines', line = list(color = 'rgb(22, 96, 167)', width = 4)) 

fig_months <- fig_months %>% layout(title = "Total guests for each hotel by month of arrival date",
         xaxis = list(title = "Months"),
         yaxis = list (title = "Total guests"))

fig_months

```


```{r}

# Country plot

df <- as.data.frame(hotel_bookings_new[hotel_bookings_new$is_canceled==0, c("country")])

df <- as.data.frame(lapply(df, function(x) as.data.frame(table(x))))

colnames(df) <- c('country', 'frequency')

fig <- plot_ly(df, type='choropleth', locations=df$country, z=df$frequency, colorscale = 'Viridis' )

fig

# scala logaritmica

fig2
```

```{r}
# Regressione su is_canceled

reg.out <- glm(is_canceled~lead_time+stays_in_week_nights+adults+meal, family='binomial')
summary(reg.out)
```
#Aggiunta variabile total_stays
hotel_bookings_new=hotel_bookings_new%>%
  mutate(total_stays=(stays_in_week_nights + stays_in_weekend_nights) )

#Regressione completa
mod_2 <- glm(is_canceled~lead_time+arrival_date_month+total_stays+adults+children+babies+meal+market_segment+distribution_channel+is_repeated_guest+adr+previous_cancellations+previous_bookings_not_canceled+booking_changes+deposit_type+days_in_waiting_list+customer_type+required_car_parking_spaces+total_of_special_requests,  family="binomial")
summary(mod_2)

#Selezione del modello
regfit.full=regsubsets(is_canceled~lead_time+total_stays+adults+children+
                       babies+meal+market_segment+distribution_channel+is_repeated_guest+adr+previous_cancellations+
                         previous_bookings_not_canceled+booking_changes+deposit_type+days_in_waiting_list+customer_type+
                         required_car_parking_spaces+total_of_special_requests, data = hotel_bookings_new, nvmax = 46)
reg.summary=summary(regfit.full)
names(reg.summary)


par(mfrow=c(2,2))
plot(reg.summary$rss,xlab="n. di predittori",ylab="RSS",type="b",pch=16,cex=.5)
rp=which.min(reg.summary$rss)
points(rp,reg.summary$rss[rp],pch=20,col="red")

plot(reg.summary$adjr2,xlab="n. di predittori",ylab="Adjusted R^2",type="b",pch=16,cex=.5)
rp=which.max(reg.summary$adjr2)
points(rp,reg.summary$adjr2[rp],pch=20,col="red")

plot(reg.summary$cp,xlab="n. di predittori",ylab="Mallow C_p",type="b",pch=16,cex=.5)
rp=which.min(reg.summary$cp)
points(rp,reg.summary$cp[rp],pch=20,col="red")

plot(reg.summary$bic,xlab="n. di predittori",ylab="BIC",type="b",pch=16,cex=.5)
rp=which.min(reg.summary$bic)
points(rp,reg.summary$bic[rp],pch=20,col="red")

par(mfrow=c(1,1))
plot(regfit.full,scale="r2")
